<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 395, 392, 411]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 429, 222, 445]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 868, 648]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 676, 213, 691]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 693, 728, 725]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 94, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 82, 144, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 109, 730, 312]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 332, 920, 370]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = k\cos (x - \frac{1}{6}\pi)\) where \(k\) is a positive constant and \(x\) is measured in radians. The curve crosses the \(x\)-axis at point \(A\) and \(B\) is a minimum point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 381, 410, 401]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 383, 920, 401]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 660, 144, 679]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 660, 549, 680]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(t\) that satisfies the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 688, 625, 714]]<|/det|>
\[3\sin^{-1}(3t) + 2\cos^{-1}\Bigl (\frac{1}{2}\sqrt{2}\Bigr) = \pi .\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 691, 920, 710]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 84, 92, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 92, 636, 265]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 282, 920, 333]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a sector of a circle with centre \(C\). The radii \(CA\) and \(CB\) each have length \(r \text{cm}\) and the size of the reflex angle \(ACB\) is \(\theta\) radians. The sector, shaded in the diagram, has a perimeter of \(65 \text{cm}\) and an area of \(225 \text{cm}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 345, 144, 364]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 345, 364, 364]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(r\) and \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 345, 920, 364]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 749, 146, 768]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 749, 390, 768]]<|/det|>
Find the area of triangle \(ACB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 749, 920, 768]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 97, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 82, 144, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 82, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
Show that the equation \(\cos \theta (7\tan \theta - 5\cos \theta) = 1\) can be written in the form \(a\sin^2\theta + b\sin \theta + c = 0\), where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are integers to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 444, 185, 463]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 444, 744, 463]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\cos 2x(7\tan 2x - 5\cos 2x) = 1\) for \(0^\circ < x < 180^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 444, 920, 463]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 82, 92, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 82, 834, 101]]<|/det|>
The first term of an arithmetic progression is 1.5 and the sum of the first ten terms is 127.5 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 114, 146, 131]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 114, 384, 131]]<|/det|>
Find the common difference.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 114, 920, 133]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 365, 186, 383]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[201, 365, 920, 383]]<|/det|>
Find the sum of all the terms of the arithmetic progression whose values are between 25 and 100.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 380, 920, 399]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[268, 96, 730, 358]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 373, 586, 395]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \sqrt{2x^3 + 10}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 406, 146, 425]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 405, 920, 440]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point where \(x = 3\). Give your answer in the form \(ax + by + c = 0\) where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are integers. [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 84, 148, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 84, 920, 119]]<|/det|>
The region shaded in the diagram is enclosed by the curve and the straight lines \(x = 1\), \(x = 3\) and \(y = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 131, 920, 165]]<|/det|>
Find the volume of the solid obtained when the shaded region is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 148, 920, 166]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 144, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 81, 604, 101]]<|/det|>
Find the sum to infinity of the progression \(a_2, a_5, a_8, \dots\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 81, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 85, 104, 104]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 85, 583, 104]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by \(\operatorname {f}(x) = 10 + 6x - x^2\) for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 117, 146, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 510, 135]]<|/det|>
By completing the square, find the range of f.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 117, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 84, 710, 104]]<|/det|>
The function g is defined by \(\mathrm{g}(x) = 4x + k\) for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\) where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 116, 146, 134]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 116, 845, 135]]<|/det|>
It is given that the graph of \(y = \mathrm{g}^{-1}\mathrm{f}(x)\) meets the graph of \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\) at a single point \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 145, 405, 164]]<|/det|>
Determine the coordinates of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 147, 920, 165]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]
